comments.commentBody: The spirituality of any religion must be questioned when its followers, not clergy, are required to wear special clothing.  What should be a matter of fashion is a matter of religion.  Very few logically thinking people can understand why some kind of wrapping, or beanie, pillbox on ones head is sacred.  To make it so, or to actually believe it is, is scary stuff.

I am a breast cancer survivor (thanks to a routine mammogram) and I absolutely HATE pink. I will not wear it. Certainly attention paid to breast cancer as a significant threat to the health of women (and men) is worthwhile, but the commercialization of the cause leaves me unmoved.

As for nancynancy comment, my early DCIS would not have been discovered had it not been for the mammogram. I was lucky, after surgery my nodes were found to be negative and the pathology showed most of the cancer still contained within the ducts with only a tiny amount starting to invade beyond. Had the radiologist not seen the "tiny grains of sand" in my ducts, I would have never known and by the time the cancer discovered, I would have faced chemo, radiation and possibly eventual death. For the record, I was 45. A prior mammogram 15 months earlier had been normal. There is no doubt the mammogram saved me from more invasive disease. I won't wear pink but I will shout out to women everywhere that mammograms DO save lives--At least, if you count mine.

"Beyond that, I'm sure Jobs himself was a donor.."

Don't be so sure. I suspect Stanford's quick move for a memorial is more anticipatory than thankful. SPJ was known to have been clear about reasons *NOT* to give to Stanford. Can you say $16 billion endowment? Steve could.

OK, why is this any different than the data my ISP can collect, or my email provider, the credit card company, the mailman, my nosy neighbor.  They know everything about my online behavior.  I suppose I could pay cash for everything and become a hermit.

Honestly I think this is happening because Steve Jobs is no longer with us :( .I think if he was still here we wouldn't be facing this icloud problem.I think that they should have left the iPhone the way it was and made the all adjustments they needed EXCEPT the icloud.The last thing I think is they should drop icloud permanently.

We asked Siri, "What's the meaning life?" Siri replied,  "Do you really want to ask this of an inanimate object?" We asked the same questions again and Siri said, "42." Nice Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy reference, Apple!
Its quite clear that we don't know Sri Lanka is independent of India.

Hello ,I t has been long time to take action against former telecom minister,could somebody tell me why this long,it bad time for Maran to collect some travel game to play in the prison and also of cause he can have chat with others,will he get warm reception in thigar jail or cold one anyway time will tell ,it is waiting game who is going to turn as approver.Have nice time Maran..

Acute lymcytic and Lymphobastic leukemia is becoming more and more dignosed condition in Indian origin Asians living in USA.Two month ago my son inlaw who is a very succesfull gastroenterologist in Jacsonville FL was dignosed having ALL.My family and freinds started bone marrow drives so far we registered 3000 people fron Indian origin but it was agreat difficult task. Many people reffused to register because they thought it will be very pain full procedure but it is not . New technology has amde in quite simple and no cost to donor . If one matches one has to go for blood test and if he or she is healthy and matches than doctor give them one injection which increses his or her white cell counts. Than few days later dotor draws theire blood and circulates through a machine just take out needed white cells and put back his or her blood back.Even many Indian doctors are not aware of this procedure.

Indian media is most corrupt, comperatively. It keeps cosiest relationship with government for money, priviledges and perks. It absolutely does not reflect vast majority of population's welfare and concerns in its presentation of news.It provides only powerful self or directed views. Even so, if it feels government
intolerance, it shows how much corrupt, rotten, and dyfunctioal and dictatorial party and administration is exploiting the name of democracy.

Actually St. Stephen's applied for permission to double capacity of it's Economics class last year. This permission was denied.

If institutions at the top of the heap don't have the autonomy to operate you can imagine what the condition of the others will be

It seems that only the NY State and Federal government benefits from having American citizens and legal residents. We are given Social Security numbers from birth so that every single penny that we earn can be tracked and taxed by State, Federal and local governments. Those SS#s are also accessible to banks so that they can keep track and monitor our "credit scores," and when the time for college comes, if our parents could not save enough money for college, we can indebted ourselves to the banks for 20+ years.

What is the point of the illegals becoming legal residents or US citizens if they are to receive the exact benefits that I am receiving? What incentive, other than an altruism, do they have to stay in this country once they graduate with a degree from an American college/university or repay the student loans (which are guaranteed by Federal government)? They will return to their country with the American college degree which will allow them to climb the steep social ladders and allow them to live very well there. The odds that they will pay back the loans are very low. Then the Federal government, or we the people, will pay that money to the bank. We are truly the greatest and dumbest nation on Earth!

By the way, I was born in this country and the daughter of Latin American LEGAL immigrants. My entire family is against the Dream Act. It is time to stop worrying about the education of illegals, who shouldn't even be here and are already benefiting in countless ways from our education and medical system. Why should they have a voice when they don't have the right to vote? Where is the concern for the American minorities who live in poor violent and drug riddled neighborhoods, and have substandard education? Hypocrites!

This is unmitigated insanity!  When I see ridiculous statements like: "who just happen to be undocumented" I become nauseated and utterly disgusted.  How about a statement like: "who just happen to be serial killers".  Same logical concept.  And then there's the argument that there are just too many of the criminal trespassers to deport.  So does that mean if we had just too many serial killers to deport, we would not even try and we'd just leave them alone?  And the unscrupulous employers who want cheap labor, rather than to pay decent legal decent wages, should all be criminally prosecuted.  They are the root cause of this mess.  When US citizens recruit them, and are government doesn't really try to prevent them from coming in, and staying, how can the illegals take our border sanctity seriously?  This is a nation of immigrants, but it used to be legal immigrants.  No more.  Look at it this way.  If 400 million muslim extremists gradually entered the country the same way as the current illegals, they would then outnumber us, and could literally steal the country away from us.  They could take power and vote to have all infidels beheaded.  Based on current processes, this is in fact theoretically possible.

I note that those finding the approach of the New York State Regents absurd outnumber those who approve by at least 10 to 1.  Is anyone paying attention?  The citizens of this country do not approve of this ridiculousness.

Yet another perfect example of how our PUBLICLY FUNDED higher education institutions operate like whimsical private institutions. They love their illegal immigrants, children of poor non-tax payers (children from generations of welfare recipients), children of well connected academics, and wealthy out-of-state students.

They love everybody except for the children of families who for generations have paid the taxes to prop up our public universities.

There's no benefit to being an American citizen anymore. At this point, if I could renounce my US citizenship and cut myself off from this insane society, I would. You get nothing but the "privilege" of being taxed, criminalized, fined and abused to death while non-citizens and interest groups get a free ride at our expense. It's total insanity.

America is weirdly obsessed with killing itself through nitwit policies that are starkly, obviously destructive to its citizens.

the evidence is very clear to see if we want to look at it. these bizarre legislative rulings are a means to an end. our end. the purpose being to drive down wages and keep america's middle class at the bottom, thereby destroying the unions and the demands of those whose expectations are good working conditions, affordable living wages, decent benefits, and upward mobility.
the new plutocracy in america, bolstered by the legislators who pretend to be in favor of the common good, want a tidal wave of low wage workers as servants of the rich.
the plutocrats have already destroyed us. it is something that has already happened. they have no intention of putting the pieces back together.
it also is strategic from their point of view to stir up hatreds that prevent solidarity of action against them.
the war is here. now. and the enemy, as pogo rightly said, is us. and, i would add, them.

Undocumented illegals have no documents, no proof, no ID, nothing. If no name, no ID, etc., the Regent can fill out 12 million applications and take all the founding. Who knows, maybe the Regent is one of the undocumented illegals... :))) Maybe the whole thing is fake, one other way to "legally" steal public money. Which bank will handle the $? Bank of America ...

#26 states- "In the greater scheme of things "illegal" is simply a technicality which can be changed to "legal" with a stroke of a pen and with the support of an informed public".  So, if I rob a bank, illegal right now, and they change the law to legalize it, no harm?  The overwhelming majority of comments here agree- they are not undocumented, they are ILLEGAL!  Help legal Americans first, and ship ILLEGALS out.  They are lawbreakers!  We are not xenophobes as many of our distant relatives came here legally.  Legally, through the front door!  Do not give children of these lawbreakers citizenship.  Discharge them from the hospital, and deport them and their parents.  If I sneak into a country, many would arrest me, some might tolerate me, but would any educate me and give me rights?  I don't think so.  They want rights?  Give them the right to an immigration attorney (billed to them of course), and the right to leave this country or the right to work in a prison and then be deported.  Harsh?  Maybe but the majority of Americans seem to say- "head them, up and move them out".

I have a dream.  My dream is that I go to sleep one night and wake up and find that my legislators have developed spines and push for deportation of all illegals found within our borders as if they are not here legally they must be breaking a law, that the Supreme Court realizes that hard-earned money from legal citizen taxpayers should not be utilized to educate illegals in the educational version of- don't ask don't tell.  Yeah, it is a dream and I have a better chance of seeing a shooting start tonight than that ever happening.

The dream act is just another example of an immigration amnesty, under a different guise.

Amnesties don't work. The US had one in 1986 when they naturalized about 3 million illegals, now they have a problem with over 11 million illegal immigrants.

If the US allows legislation like the dream act how many illegal immigrants will they have to deal with in 2050, 50 million?

This is not out of the question. Anybody who knows what is happening in the rest of the world knows that with the worlds population approaching about 9 Billion by 2030, up from 7 Billion people today, the pressure to immigrate to a developed country, from the developing world is going to increase dramatically. The approximate 2 Billion people are all going to be added in the developing world. With the increasing mobility of people and also the dramatic rise of automation and robotics that is massively reducing the demand for unskilled/low skilled workers no country is going to want the expensive burden of these people, people who aren't their citizens.

It is now the developed world who is starting to take a strong stance against illegal immigrants, but some countries in the developing world are also working out that if they want to improve the lives of their people they also need to control their immigration. Why would a country do all the hard work of going through the demographic transition, of reducing its birth rates so it can improve their citizens lives, only to be swamped by people from other countries who are not taking the tough decisions to limit population growth and force themselves through the demographic transition. For those that don't know the demographic transition is one of the important steps that a country is required to go through to achieve prosperity for its people.

Essentially, this policy, like so many others, is saying that those who enter our country illegally will be rewarded for breaking the law. I can only imagine that immigrants who entered this country legally and spent years wading through bureaucratic red tape (not to mention tens of thousands of dollars) to gain legal citizenship must feel like fools. They could have saved a lot of time and money if only they had entered the country illegally!

As a former resident of New York State, I am baffled by the decision to extend financial aid to illegal immigrants. The community in which I used to live had a hospital that was on the verge of bankruptcy in part (probably large part) due to illegals using the ER as their primary care physician and never paying the bill. It had one school district in dire financial straits due to illegals having three families living in a single family home so that the property taxes did not cover the extra children going to school. Not to mention the bilingual teachers the schools had to hire and the translators that the courts had to employ, due to the large non-English speaking population. The voting ballot was even translated into Spanish!

In an age when states cannot afford to pay for social services for their LEGAL citizens, it is nothing more than insanity to spend state resources (which are coming from where?) to further assist and enable those living in this country illegally. This money would be better used to assist immigrants that are here legally, and on their way to citizenship.

If the New York taxpayers want to reward illegal immigrants, that is their business, just don't expect the rest of the nation to chip in.
You must remember; It is illegal to enter the United States without proper documentation and the law doesn't say anything about a person's age. Give them driver's license, I suppose the taxpayers will be expected to buy them a car next.

Why hasn't an out-of state student sued for discrimination in paying out-of-state tuition when illegal aliens get to go at in-state rates? I say the ACLU defend legal students and help them obtain the same tuition breaks that illegals get. I live in Texas and Rick Perry lets illegals get free tuition, while my son who recently moved from CA and is seeking a masters degree is forced to pay outrageously high out of state tuition. Not only is this unfair, but as Perry likes to say about everything he disagrees with, it's "UnAmerican".

Don't people see that our illegal Immigration problem will not stop until the incentives for coming here illegally stop? Some of the incentives now: free k-12 education, in Spanish at many schools. Free or reduced price school lunches and breakfasts. Menial jobs, but still at a higher pay than in the country of origin. In state tuition at a state school, and now financial aid because even in state tuition is too high. Why wouldn't someone come here illegally?

Why should illegal immigrants (they are not "children of illegals". Unless they were born in the US, they are illegal) have access to state run colleges? Have we reached the point where every legal NY citizen can easily afford college? How about this? In May of each year, after colleges have received replies from all students that they have offered admission to, they will determine if there is space available. If there is space available, let illegal immigrants apply and pay international student rates. If there are excess funds available after all citizen students have had their demonstrated financial need met, then let the illegal students use that too. Anything else is a slap in the face to the many NY families who are struggling to pay tuition or did not get into the state school of their choice.
